Context:
The Procurement Department of George Brown College is responsible for facilitating the acquisition of goods and services for the college community, Ontario residents, and vendors. They aim to achieve the best value for money while adhering to BPS Directives and supporting the college's objectives. The department provides functional management, leadership, and policy direction for procurement activities.

The goal is to ensure effective and efficient management of acquisition processes for internal clients, helping them plan acquisitions at fair prices using the best methods and tools while maintaining high professional and service integrity. The department ensures an open, fair, transparent, and competitive process for all vendors.

The Procurement and Contract Services website offers general procurement policies and contract information based on established policies and industry-standard practices. Users can sign up for college news, application deadlines, upcoming events, tours, and more. Contact information includes the phone number 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and email address ask.george@georgebrown.ca.

The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.

There is no explicit mention of programs offered by the college in the provided text.
